G4619-d-09-14-99-WC.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
G4619-d-09-14-99-WC.Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
G4619-d-09-14-99-WC.Narrative: THE 0730 WW SWITCH CREW WAS PULLING WEST ON THE SWITCHING LEAD WITH 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 55 EMPTIES WHEN THEY COLLIDED WITH THE 0700 SWITCH JOB.  THE 0700 WE SWITCH JOB CONSISTED OF 2 LOCOMOTIVES AND 108EMPTIES THEY WERE ON TRACK 55 HEADED TO DEXTER LEAD.  THE 0730 WW SWITCH CREW WAS TRAVELING AT APPROXIMATELY 1 MPH WHEN THE ENGINEER REALIZED THAT HE WAS GOING TO HIT THE 0700 WE SWITCH JOB TRAVELINGAT APPROXIMATELY 5 MPH. THE ENGINEER FAILED TO STOP HIS TRAIN IN THE CLEAR CAUSING HIS ENGINE TO SIDE-SWIPE 11 CARS IN THE 0700 WE SWITCH'S TRAIN.  THE ENGINE DID NOTIFY THE YARD IMMEDIATELY, VIA RADIO, OF THE INCIDENT TO STOP THE 0700 WE'S MOVEMENT TO PREVENT FURTHER DAMAGE.  HE ALSO BLEW A NUMBEROF SHORT BLASTS ON HIS WHISTLE.  ENGINE 1568 AND 11 CARS WERE DAMAGED, NOTHING DERAILED.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED IN THE INCIDENT.  TESTING WAS DONE AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

154107-d-09-11-99-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
154107-d-09-11-99-SOO.Narrative: WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN Y080  MANNED BY WC CREW  OPERATING OVER SOO/CP AND MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL TRACKAGE, NEW BRIGHTON, MN PERFORMING SWITCHING OPERATIONS THROUGH SSO/CP'S WEST LEG OF THE WYE AND MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL'S  #1 YARD TRACK  GOING ONTO THE MINNESOTA  COMMERCIAL MAIN TRACK DERAILED EIGHT CARS DURING SHOVE DUE TO IMPROPERLY LINED SWITCH BY WC CONDUCTOR.   SOO/CP INCURRED $270 IN TRACK DAMAGE.  WC CENTRAL ADVISED THEIR EQUIPMENT IS ESTIMATED AT $26,700.   MN COMMERCIAL INCURRED $5,397 TOTHEIR TRACK, THEIR REPORTING NUMBER IS SEP-99-001.  PER 1081I REPORT: THE TRAIN CREW ON WISCONSIN CENTRAL TRAIN Y080-11 WERE ATTEMPTING TO SHOVE EAST FROM THE PAYNESVILLE SUB MAIN TRACK, THROUGH THE WEST LEG OF THE WYE, ONTO THE MINNESOTA COMMERCIAL MAIN TRACK AT NEW BRIGHTON YARD.  MOVEMENT INADVERTENTLY SHOVED INTO #1 TRACK INSTEAD, WHICH ALREADY CONTAINED CARS, AND COLLIDED WITH THE STATIONARYCARS AT OF SPEED OF  APPROXIMATELY 10 MPH.    THE WC CONDUCTOR HAD CHECKED THE SWITCHES NEEDED FOR THIS MOVE FROM THE WC COMPANY AUTOMOBILE EARLIER, AND THEY APPEARED TO BE LINED CORRECTLY.  HE THEN PROCEEDED TO THE EAST END OF THE NEW BRIGHTON YARD AND CHECKED SOME OTHER SWITCHES.  WHILE HE WAS ATTHE EAST END OF THE YARD HE NOTICED THAT CARS IN #1 TRACK WERE MOVING, AND INSTRUCTED THE LOCOMOTIVEENGINEER TO STOP.  INITIAL INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE SWITCHES WERE FOUND TO BE LINED FOR MOVEMENT ONTO #1 TRACK.  AS A RESULT OF THE IMPACT,  8 CARS ON THE WC Y080-11 TRAIN DERAILED ON #1 TRACK

990907-d-09-21-99-PW.Narrative: TRAIN NR-2 WAS TRAVELING IN A NORTHWARD DIRECTION ON THE NORWOICH BRANCH AT 30 MPH. AS THE TRAIN APPROACHED MILES POST 17 THE ENGINEER NOTICED THAT AN ARM OF THE BALLAST REGULATOR THAT WAS PARKED ON NORWICH LUMBER SIDING WAS FOULING THE MAIN LINE.  THE ENGINEER PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE STRICKING THE MACHINE. THE FUEL TANK ON THE LOCOMOTIVE 2216 WAS PUNCTURE ANDAPPROXIMATELY 1300 GALLONS OF FUEL SPILLED ON  TO THE RIGHT OF WAY.  THE LOCOMOTIVE 2216 IS A GENERAL ELECTRIC MODELS U23-B WITH A FUEL CAPACITY OF 2000 GALLONS.  AT THE START OF THE CREW SHIFT IT WAS RECORED THAT 1700 GALLONS WAS IN THE TANK.  IT IS ESTIMATED THAT 200 GALLONS WAS CONSUMED PRIOR TOTHE INCIDENT. A ENVIORONMENTAL CONTRACTOR HIRED BY THE RAILROAD RECOVERED 850 GALLONS WITH A VACUUMTRUCK 230 GALLONS WAS RECOVERED FROM THE FUEL TANK.  TWO ROLL-OFF CONTAINERS OF OIL SOAKED BALLAST WAS REMOVED FROM THE SIDE OF THE TRACK AND NEW BALLAST INSTALLED IN ITS PLACE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THIS STRAND WAS TEMPORARILY ANCHORED TO CATENARY 390 USING A DEAD END SHOE.  THE PRIVATE CONTRACTOR FAILED TO TIGHTEN THE "U" BOLTS TIGHT ENOUGH ON THE DEAD END SHOE AND THE STRAND SLIPPED OUT OF THE SHOE. GT04699-d-09-11-99-GTW.Narrative: TRAIN E-25861-11 YARDING TRAIN IN TRACK SR08. TRAIN LENGTH EXCEEDED TRACK LENGTH SO TRAIN HAD BEEN PULLED OUT ON LEAD AND WAS PREPARING TO STOP TO  MAKE CUT FOR DOUBLE OVER MOVE. BEFORE STOPPING, A YARD TRACK CR02 ROLLED OUT SOUTH END OF TRACK WHILE SWITCHING ON TO THE LEAD AND SOUTH CAR GTW127088 STRUCK THE 32ND CAR (ETTX800446) AND 33RD CAR (ETTS906896) CAUSING SIDE SWIPE DAMAGE, THEN STRUCK 34TH CAR (ETTX900446) DERALING SAME WITH SIDE DAMAGE, THEN 35TH CAR (ETTX908057) DERAILING L&R 3&4 WITHSIDE DAMAGE. THE GTW127088 ALSO HAD R&L 3&4 WHEELS DERAILED. THE GTW127088 THAT CAME OUT OF CR02 WAS SWITCHED INTO THE SOUTH END OF THE TRACK ALONG WITH 10 OTHER CARS AS A BLOCK OF CARS AT 2:30 PM ON9/11. THE BLOCK OF 11 CARS WAS SHOVED INTO THE TRACK, THROUGH THE INERT RETARDER LOCATED APPROX. 5CAR LENGTHS FRON THE LEAD. AT APPROX. 10:40 PM, YARD JOB 726 SWITCHED A BLOCK OF 8 CARS INTO THE NORTH END OF CR02 RESULTING IN A TOTAL OF 38 CARS IN THE TRACK WITH 170' OF REMAINING CAPACITY COUPLINGSPEED ESTIMATED AT 3 MPH. THE COUPLING MOVEMENT WAS NOT RETARDED BY INERT ON SOUTH END WHICH ALLOWED TRACK TO ROLL OUT TO FOUL AND COME IN CONTACT WITH 258 TRAIN ON LEAD. ON 12/27/99 DIV. SUPT. HOUGHTON REQUESTED AMMENDED REPORT, ACCEPTING RESPONSIBILITY FOR NOT HAVING INSTRUCTIONS IN PLACE TO SETHAND BRAKES ON CARS ON YARD TRACKS.None

DE0999205-d-09-16-99-DMVW.Narrative: DMVW TRAIN CAME TO INTO HANKINSON.  LEFT LOADS ON THE MISSOURI MAIN ON THE DMVW.  THEN CAME IN TO THE YARD.  PUT39 EMPTIES ON THE MAIN FROM THE SIDING.  THE SECOND MOVE WAS TO TAKE 16 EMPTIES FROM #3TRACK AND PLACED THEM ON THE MAIN, COUPLING INTO THE PREVIOUS CUT.  THEN THE DMVW CREW WENT INTO #2TRACK AND PULLED OUT 23 CARS AND PLACED THEM ON THE MAIN COLLIDING WITH THE CARS PREVIOUSLY PLACED ON THE MAIN TRACK.  LISTING THE MOVES STATED ABOVE, ASKED CONDUCTOR IF HE WAS RIDING THE POINT, PROTECTING THE SHOVE.  HE STATED, NO HE WAS NOT.  HE WAS LOCATED AT THE NUMBER #2 TRACK SWITCH AT THE TIME OF THE COLLISION.  THE NEXT QUESTION ASKED WAS  HOW CONDUCTOR WAS PROTECTING THE SHOVE.  HE STATEDTHAT HE WAS COUNTING THE CARS.  HE THOUGHT THAT THEY HAD A HOLD OF 23 CARS.  CONDUCTOR ESTIMATED THAT THE SPEED OF IMPACT WAS ABOUT 6 TO 7 MPH, ALSO STATING THAT THE MOVEMENT WAS BEING SLOWED DOWN ACCOUNT THEY THOUGHT THEY WERE GETTING CLOSE.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone
